title: Filter Even Numbers
description: Create a new array containing only even numbers from the original array
instructions:
Write a function `filterEvens(arr)` that takes an array of numbers and returns a new array containing only the even numbers.

Example: filterEvens([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]) should return [2, 4, 6]

Note: Try using a loop and push(), not the built-in .filter() method

hints.content: Create a new empty array and add even numbers to it as you loop through the original array.
Use the modulo operator (%) to check if a number is even (num % 2 === 0). Create an empty array and push even numbers into it.
Start with `const evens = [];`. Loop through the array and use `if (arr[i] % 2 === 0)` to check for even numbers, then `evens.push(arr[i])` to add them.

learningObjectives: Creating new arrays from existing ones
Understanding the modulo operator for even/odd checks
